summary:
•	Wide and deep experience in Industrial Operations Management in consumer durable goods companies such as Eletrolux and GE / Mabe, managing the areas of manufacturing, engineering, quality, research and development.
•	International Experience leading the refrigerators factory and project teams at Electrolux Chile for 7 years with the achievement of goals and desired results and several international trips to China, Japan, Germany, Italy, Portugal, Mexico, Colombia, Argentina and Peru for development Projects and suppliers, as well as visits to clients in Latin America.
•	Project Manager of New Products, Manufacturing, Quality and Engineering of White Line Products, for the Brazilian and Latin American markets.
•	Success story conducting initiatives for Cost Reduction of raw material and transformation.
•	As general manager for operations, he led the start-up process for the white-line factory (refrigerators and freezers) of the company CCE (future Mabe / GE) in the city of Itu.
•	Coach Trainer, Manager and Leader of Multidisciplinary Teams, sponsor of participative work environments and conducive to team satisfaction, achievement and growth.
•	Great experience in Strategic Planning for the area of operations focused on Budget, Capex, Investments and Development of New Products.
•	Six Sigma Green Belt Leader and Sponsor on dozens of projects of varying sizes and complexities.
•	MBA in Business Management from FGV, Postgraduate in Business Planning and Management from the Faculty of Administration and Economics of Paraná, Postgraduate in Thermofluidodynamics from USP and Unicamp, Mechanical Engineer from the State University of Maranhão.
•	Fluent English and Spanish

profile_positions.title: Partner and Executive Director

profile_positions.description:
•	Responsible for the total management of the areas of industrial operation and research and development for refrigerators plant. Direct management of plant managers, quality, R & D and industrial engineering.
•	Managed the development and implementation of a new global line of refrigerators in the Santiago plant, with a 16MUSD investment to compete with the LG and Samsung Koreans, enabling a 16% improvement in market share, 9.0% in the Operating profit and volume increase in the factory of 90K units.
•	I led the Lean Manufacturing process in the Refrigerators factory, obtaining results improvement of 9% in quality and 8% in delivery.
•	Conducted several Direct Materials cost reduction projects, leading multidisciplinary teams that generated an impact of 3.5% reduction per unit per year over 7 years.
•	Coordinated the development of products with energy classification "A", making them more competitive in the market, generating a 3% increase in MS and reducing costs by 10%.
•	Led the development of a new supplier of Horizontal Freezers generating a cost savings of 20% and reaching 70% of Market Share.
•	Managed the development and implementation of the "Mix Model" manufacturing system, resulting in improved delivery to customers in quantity, time and model, with a "Fill Rate" increase of 10%

profile_positions.description:
•	Conducted the process of structuring the operational area (Engineering, Logistics, PCP and Maintenance)
•	Implementation of management and motivational systems with improvements in occupation rates (5%) and maintenance (3%) in the 6-month period.
profile_positions.title: Operations Manager

profile_positions.description:
•	Reverted critical delay of five months in the startup of the refrigerators factory, establishing a new model of project management and achieving a high degree of commitment and responsibility of those involved. In three months, the products were launched and in a year already accounted for a share of 10%.
•	In 12 months, I approved the design, machinery, equipment, devices and processes of the new CCE refrigerators factory, current Mabe, millions of dollars investment.
•	In the Technology Area, I sought the continuous improvement of processes and products, with significant financial returns.
•	I led a multifunctional group (marketing, product / process engineering, design, quality and production) that, in two months and with a shortage of resources, successfully launched the new line of Dako refrigerators, replacing the CCE line.
•	Idealized and implemented a quality information system at the critical points of the production process, which streamlined and increased the reliability of the decisions and also got a greater involvement of all responsible areas.
•	For the development and production of low-energy refrigerators, I have been able to obtain the Procel Energy Efficiency Seal for the last seven years.
•	Reduced unit freight cost by developing and deploying packaging for the transportation of reclining refrigerators.
•	I created and implemented the CCE Electrodomestics operating system, which resulted in systematization, sharing and agility in the decision-making processes.
•	As a Program Manager, having a small team and integrating internal, external vendor resources and other Mabe sites, I deployed 24 new core products in five years.
•	Led the development and deployment, in seven months, of a product that went from high consumption to low energy consumption, with Procel Seal. The objective was to participate in the tenders of the energy distributors, who exchanged the high consumption refrigerators used by the population of low income
profile_positions.title: Plant Manager, Projects, Product / Industrial, and Quality Engineering

profile_positions.description:
•	Reduced development time by 30% and project costs by 40% with the implementation of Simultaneous Engineering, a model that integrates and approximates the phases of the project and amplifies the synergy of resources.
•	I defined and negotiated the criteria for the transfer to Curitiba of a team of Engineers and Technicians, which met the need to centralize engineering while respecting individual conditions.
•	Led the project that launched a new line of refrigerators, leader of its category at the time, expanding the portfolio of products and eliminating redundancy until then between two similar products (Climax and Prosdócimo).
•	I was part of the technical group that traveled to Japan to obtain data from Sanyo for the installation of the air conditioning plant in Brazil.
•	Managed the development of CFC-free products, a joint project with technicians from Sanyo Japan.
•	I was the Project Manager of the launch of the Prosdócimo refrigerator line, a milestone in technological and design innovation.
